title.rendered: Find Rooms For Rent In Lansing, Michigan

content.rendered:
Lansing, Michigan’s capital, is underrated but well worth a visit, with interesting museums, fine dining, and pleasant parks close to the city center. What’s not to like? Roomi will guide you with all there is to know to live in the beautiful city, exploring neighborhoods and cheap rooms for rent in Lansing. Life in the capital city can be more than comfortable, it’s exhilarating! So, let’s get going.

Getting to know Lansing

The area was unsettled even before Lansing became Michigan’s capital city, with extensive forestry and plentiful wildlife. In the years following the repositioning of the state capital, the tiny village grew rapidly. The region combines the best of all worlds, combining the down-to-earth spirit of the Midwest with the sophisticated facilities of a state capital.

Here’s an analysis of the population and average rent in Lansing. Further, let’s look at how to get around the city’s vibrant neighborhoods to make most of your life in the state capital!

Finding rooms for rent in Lansing

Find Rooms For Rent In Lansing, Michigan

Lansing is the fifth largest city in Michigan, with a population of 118,210 inhabitants and 51 districts. Lansing is a community with a large ethnic diversity. Lansing residents identify themselves as belonging to a mix of racial and ethnic identities. Moreover, the average room rent in Lansing is $915, a rise of 5% from the previous year. Areas with cheap rooms for rent in Lansing include The Stadium District ($600) and Southeast Lansing ($760).

Related: Rules To Set In Apartments For Rent With Roommates

Top Neighborhoods in Lansing

  • Downtown: This neighborhood encompasses the State Capitol and the stores and restaurants on S Washington Square. Hence, Downtown is the first stop for most visitors and has great deals with cheap rooms for rent in Lansing.
  • East Lansing: On the other bank of the Grand River, East Lansing is down to earth and diverse, with superb Mexican eateries like El Azteco and the campus of Michigan State University. It is suitable for students and young professionals alike.
  • Waverly: Over in western Lansing, Waverly is dominated by the massive Lansing Mall, the city’s biggest shopping complex.

Average rent in Lansing

University life in Lansing

Most universities offer on-campus housing, where you can choose to live in dorms as well. But if you’re looking for cheap rooms for rent in Lansing, we’ll help you ease the process of finding the best universities in Lansing.

Top universities in and around Lansing.

  • Lansing Community College
  • Michigan State University
  • Great Lakes Christian College
  • Baker College
  • Career Quest Learning Centers Lansing Campus

Related: Tips On How To Save Money For Everyone

How transit friendly is Lansing?

1. Public Transportation

Greater Lansing has a long list of transportation options for residents and visitors. For a quick trip or exploring cheap rooms for rent in Lansing, hop on a CATA bus. The Capital Area Transportation Authority (CATA) offers convenient bus routes throughout Lansing. CATA’s public bus network covers the whole city and single tickets cost just $1.25. Lansing is also located on the beautiful Midwest Amtrak train route.

2. Taxi

Taxis in Lansing charge around $2.50 per mile in the center of town, and Uber is also active in the city, so you may be able to get around for less. Other locally owned and operated cab services like Green Cab Company is a good option to consider for taxi and delivery services.

3. Airports

Going for a longer trip? The Capital City Airport has added more direct flights from major cities with direct service from Atlanta, Orlando, and D.C. The Airport also provides a wide range of car rental services.

4. Car in Lansing

For those who prefer to stay on the ground, there are also various limo rental services in the Lansing area to serve you. You can rent a car in Lansing from branches of Avis or Enterprise, and rates can be as little as $15 per day. This can be a convenient transit option when you’re looking for rooms for rent in Lansing.

Visit worthy spots in Lansing

  • From the fossil displays at the Michigan State University Museum to the inspiring Michigan Women’s Historical Center, Lansing is lucky to have some fantastic museums.
  • Take a tour of the Michigan State Capitol, which has a 260-foot-high dome, sculptures, and paintings, as well as a 260-foot-high dome. It’s one of the most magnificent civic structures in the United States.
  • With constant performances at the Riverwalk Theatre, classical music at the Wharton Center for Performing Arts, and less sophisticated entertainment at Mac’s Bar or the Loft, Lansing punches way above its weight in terms of culture.

Restaurants in Lansing

The dining scene in Lansing, Michigan, has something special for everybody. Here’s a list of the best restaurants in the state capital that you can’t miss out on!

  • Meat Southern BBQ and Carnivore Cuisine is a meat-dream lover’s dining destination, serving up some of Lansing’s most famous barbecue.
  • Soup Spoon Café, a cozy breakfast, lunch, and dinner place in the heart of Lansing, is known for its wholesome homemade soups and serves six handcrafted varieties. If you’re in the neighborhood looking for rooms for rent in Lansing, don’t forget to check out this great spot!
  • The Cosmos, a chef-driven restaurant specializing in wood-fired pizzas, has been outshining local diners with its delectable signature pies.

D’you know what else Roomi does outside of helping its readers find cheap rooms for rent in Lansing? With our ever-increasing lists of rooms and roommates across the world, we help you find your perfect match! Download the app here and hop on the easiest ride home, ever!
